author: ethdreamer
content:
I'm trying to understand the new rollup-centric roadmap. I remember a year ago, the eth2 roadmap had a concept of multiple execution environments, which would abstract the execution semantics of any conceivable programmable blockchain.

It kind of looks like (in this rollup-centric roadmap) that rollups take the place of execution environments, so to the experience is basically the same to the end user?

author: ethdreamer
content: In other words, this roll-up direction can provide the same UX in terms of composability and the same security guarantees as L1 (in the non-optimistic case)?

author: ralexstokes
content: pretty much -- as long as the L2 is secure then it can host whatever VM/execution semantics it wants

author: ralexstokes
content: e.g. someone could write an optimistic rollup that uses webassembly instead of the EVM
